body.p: Kentucky minister and teacher. Versailles, Kentucky native. Married to Sarah A. Corwine Stevenson. Father of Lucy Stevenson. Graduated from Transylvania University in 1847. Teacher in Mississippi in Winter 1847. Studied law in Mississippi. Teacher in Clark County, Kentucky, in 1848. Professor at Whitewater Female College in Centerville, Indiana from 1848 to 1850. Returned to Versailles to open a school for girls. Methodist Episcopal minister in Kenton County in 1850. Member of the Kentucky Conference of the Methodist Episcopal Church, South starting in 1851. Served in Orangeburg, Taylorsville, Danville, Newport, Carrollton, Millersburg, Shelbyville, and Frankfort. Lived in Danville, Kentucky, in 1853. Lived in Franklin County in 1863. Member of the Union Party. Superintendent of Public Instruction for Kentucky from 1863 to 1867.
